material.mattext: In which of the following areas of computing do we apply knowledge of compiler techniques
The syntax tree or the parse tree is the output of which of the following stages of compilation
A sequence of characters from the input stream grouped into meaningful sequences is known as:
What is the main function of the symbol table?
To data that is not required during compilation process
To provide quick and uniform access to identifier attributes throughout the compilation process
To store values of the varibales being used in the compilation process
Helps the lexical analyzer sort the sequence of characters coming in as a stream from the source program
What is the role of the Instruction Set in Compiler Implementation
Storage Mechanisms Supported and Access Protocols
The following are the main aspects of the Instruction Set Architecture (ISA) except
Take the odd one out based on the RISC and CISC Architectures
Programming Languages are usually infinite but always decidable
Which of the following errors can a compiler check?
Which derivation uses a top-down parser while parsing some input strings? Assume that the input is scanned in the order of left to right.
The rightmost derivation that is traced out in reverse
The leftmost derivation that is traced out in reverse
A major distinction between DFA and an NFA is
All DFAs are derived from NFAs but not all DFAs are NFAs
NFA cannot use Empty String transition but DFA can
NFAs might be several possible final states but DFAs have one defined final state
For a Context-Free Grammar, the intersection between the terminals and non terminals is always an empty set
Three Address Codes are useful for Intermediate Representation. There are Three Address Codes (TACs) for:
Which of the following statements is/are true?
Programming Languages are usually finite languages
Which one of the following does not constitute a significant aspect of Regular Languages?
The decision problem of any regular language is solved by the Pumping Lemma
Lexical Analyzers are essentially Deterministic Finite Automata
Which of the following does not constitute a significant aspect of a Context-Free Grammar (CFG)?
The decision problem of a Context-Free Grammar is solved by a Deterministic Push-Down Automata
Programming Language Syntax is specified by Regular Expressions
What is the description of the language specified by the Regular Expression 0*10*?
The set of all strings starting and ending with 0
The set of strings containing at least one 1
The set of strings containing at least 2 zeros
The set of strings containing a single 1
The set of strings with 1 in the middle
Populating the symbol table of the compiler with source program information occurs at which stage of compilation?
What happens at the pre-processing stage before compilation?
Attributes stored in symbol tables pertaining to identifiers, particularly variables include;
Making sure the index of an array is an integer for a typical programming language is performed by;
Consider the following code fragment with an obvious error if (x =S){ console.WriteLn (“x has the value S”); } eles { console.WriteLn (“x does not have the value S”); }
Which of the following statements are true about Three Address Code (TAC)?
Some TAC have more than 3 operands
All TAC assignments have at most 2 operators
During the code optimization phase of compilation, there are some commonly used techniques, they include;
Removing unreachable sections of the code
Which of the following statements is false
D. Not every infinite language is undecidable
Programming languages are usually infinite but always decidable
When are two(2) languages A and B over the same alphabet said to equal
When Languages A and B can be recognised by a Finite State Machine
When Languages A and B can be recognised by a Regular Expression
When language A is a subset of language B and vice versa
When a Finite State Machine can be derived for A and B
The description of the form that a lexeme of a token may take, during lexical analysis is known as a
Which of the following is not a Compiler Construction Tool?
Which of the following formally defines a Context-Free Grammar?
G = (Q, V, E, d, q, F)
Which of the following formally defines a Deterministic Finite Automata?
M = (Q, V, E, d, q, F)
When is a language A said to be regular?
If the language is a non-empty set of well defined strings
If there exists a finite automata that recognises it
If a grammar can be built for the language
The domain of the transition function of a Deterministic Finite Automaton is given by
Which of the of the following languages is described by the regular expression 0(0 U 1)*0 U 1(0 U 1)*1 U 0 U 1
All binary strings starting with 0 and ending with 1
All binary strings starting with 1 and ending with 0
All binary strings starting with 0 and ending with 0
All binary strings starting with 1 and ending with 1
All binary strings starting and ending with the same symbol
For each a in a non-empty alphabet E, a is a regular expression
If the cardinality of set A is greater than the cardinality of set B, then there is no injective function form A to B. This is known as the:
WHat is the language of the grammar given by G = (V, E, R, S), where V = {S}, E = {a, b}, and R = {S -> e, S -> aSb, S -> SS},
The language of all Strings starting with a and ending with b
The language of all Strings starting with a or ending in b
The language of all properly nested parenthesis
The following are regular operations except
